body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
spack --env foo install texlive
...
==> texlive: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> texlive: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/tmp/spackswinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-texlive-20190410-iaad5nhkmckku27t6rr6rjtldib24vtn/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/cvmfs/hpcsw.umd.edu/spack-software/2021.11.29/linux-rhel8-zen/gcc-8.4.0/texlive-20190410-iaad5nhkmckku27t6rr6rjtldib24vtn' '--bindir=/cvmfs/hpcsw.umd.edu/spack-software/2021.11.29/linux-rhel8-zen/gcc-8.4.0/texlive-20190410-iaad5nhkmckku27t6rr6rjtldib24vtn/bin/x86_64-linux' '--disable-dvisvgm' '--disable-native-texlive-build' '--disable-static' '--enable-shared' '--with-banner-add= - Spack' '--dataroot=/cvmfs/hpcsw.umd.edu/spack-software/2021.11.29/linux-rhel8-zen/gcc-8.4.0/texlive-20190410-iaad5nhkmckku27t6rr6rjtldib24vtn' '--with-system-cairo' '--with-system-freetype2' '--with-system-gd' '--with-system-gmp' '--with-system-graphite2' '--with-system-harfbuzz' '--with-system-icu' '--with-system-libpaper' '--with-system-libpng' '--with-system-mpfr' '--with-system-pixman' '--with-system-poppler' '--with-system-teckit' '--with-system-zlib' '--with-system-zziplib'

1 error found in build log:
     208    checking how to hardcode library paths into programs... immediate
     209    checking whether ln -s works... yes
     210    checking for TeX specific libraries to build... texk/kpathsea texk/ptexenc
     211    checking for pkg-config... pkg-config
     212    checking for freetype-config... freetype-config
     213    checking for pkg-config... (cached) pkg-config
  >> 214    configure: error: did not find pixman-1 0.18 or better

See build log for details:
  /tmp/spackswinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-texlive-20190410-iaad5nhkmckku27t6rr6rjtldib24vtn/spack-build-out.txt
```
In the above, the package.yaml for env foo sets the texlive version to @20190410

There seems to be an issue with dependencies, in addition to the issue with pixman above, I am not seeing any specs if I do not explicitly set the version, e.g,
```console
$ spack --env foo spec -lI texlive
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   texlive

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   iaad5nh  texlive@20190410%gcc@8.4.0 scheme=small arch=linux-rhel8-zen
```

yet if I explicitly give the (same) version, I see dependencies, e.g.
```console
$ spack --env foo spec -lI texlive@20190410
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   texlive@20190410

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: using "gtkplus@2.24.32" which is a deprecated version

[+]  s6ejp4x          ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@8.4.0 patches=35c449281546376449766f92d49fc121ca50e330e60fefcfc9be2af3253082c2,7793209b33013dc0f81208718c68440c5aae80e7a1c4b8d336e382525af791a7,a49dd5bac3b62daa0ff688ab4d508d71dbd2f4f8d7e2a02321926346161bf3ee arch=linux-rhel8-zen
```

Why am I not getting the dependencies unless I specify a version?  I am wondering if it has to do with the clingo concretizer and the fact that texlive missing string ('live') and numeric (e.g. 20190410) versions.
